title: Trie Data Structure for String Storage
description: A trie, also known as a prefix tree, is a tree-like data structure used to store and retrieve a set of strings. It is commonly used in search engines, spell checkers, and IP routers. In a trie, each node represents a character in a string, and the path from the root to a leaf node represents a complete string.

meta.title: Trie Data Structure | Prefix Tree | Search Engine Optimization
meta.description: Explore the trie data structure, a powerful tree-like data structure used in search engines, spell checkers, and IP routers. Learn how to implement find, insert, remove, and list_words methods.
meta.keywords: trie, prefix tree, data structure, search engine, spell checker, IP router, find, insert, remove, list_words
